headline: Emerson Electric slips, Carmax upgraded, Perrigo sales miss
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Emerson Electric (EMR) stock is under pressure after the company reported third quarter results. Carmax (KMX) was upgraded to Neutral from Underweight by JPMorgan. The firm also lowered its price target on the stock to $58 from $65. Perrigo (PRGO) stock is sliding after the company reported a net earnings and sales miss. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Emerson Electric bumps up profit view on lower cost risk from tariffs, firm demand
summary: Engineering solutions provider Emerson Electric slightly raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday, banking on reduced cost exposure to tariffs and higher demand for its intelligent devices segment. However, its shares fell more than 7% in premarket trading. The company's intelligent devices business benefited from a rise in demand for its measurement and analytical components, as well as pressure-relief and safety-valve components.

headline: Emerson Electric (NYSE:EMR) Misses Q2 Revenue Estimates, Stock Drops
summary: Engineering and automation solutions company Emerson (NYSE:EMR) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales rose 3.9% year on year to $4.55 billion. On the other hand, the company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $4.90 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.52 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.
